markdown:
Seugathi reality warpers create and destroy inhospitable environments on a small scale by manipulating the forces of raw chaos. A [neothelid](/Monsters.aspx?ID=739) might spawn such a seugathi to create habitats for unique slaves or guests, or to destroy the ecosystem of a troublesome species. Darklands scholars refer to reality warpers as veterans in the seugathi ranks, but they're more accurately compared to aggressive landscape architects. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 28 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 [Seugathi Reality Warper](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1049) **Source** [Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil](/Sources.aspx?ID=75) pg. 83 **Perception** +17; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) 30 feet **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +19, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +19, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +19, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +20, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +18, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +17, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +19, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +19 **Str** +4 **Dex** +6 **Con** +3 **Int** +4 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +5 **Items** [_+1 battle axe_](/Weapons.aspx?ID=16) --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +18 **Ref** +21 **Will** +15 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 120 **Immunities** [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), poison **Resistances** bludgeoning 10 **Mindfog Aura** ([enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 20 feet. A creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 25 Will save or become [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5) for 1 round; on a success, that creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute. A seugathi can suppress or activate this aura as a single action with the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait.
**Command Confusion** **Trigger** A creature fails its save against the seugathi's mindfog aura; **Effect** The seugathi determines who the confused creature attacks for that round, instead of the target being randomly determined by the GM. If the chosen target is the confused creature's ally, the creature can immediately attempt a DC 25 Will save; on a success, its target is determined randomly as normal for confusion, and on a critical success the target is no longer confused --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** bite +19 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)), **Damage** 2d6+8 piercing plus 1d10 chaotic plus seugathi venom **Melee** battle axe +18 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 1d8+8 bludgeoning plus 1d10 chaotic **Occult Innate Spells** DC 28, attack +20 - **Cantrips (5th)** [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177), [Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334) - **3rd** [Hypercognition](/Spells.aspx?ID=156) (×3), [Levitate](/Spells.aspx?ID=170) (×3), [Mind Reading](/Spells.aspx?ID=194) (×3) - **4th** [Confusion](/Spells.aspx?ID=48) (×3), [Phantasmal Killer](/Spells.aspx?ID=219), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) - **5th** [Black Tentacles](/Spells.aspx?ID=23), [Crushing Despair](/Spells.aspx?ID=57), [Hallucination](/Spells.aspx?ID=144), [Synesthesia](/Spells.aspx?ID=328) **Envenom Weapon** ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) The seugathi applies their seugathi venom to one weapon they wield. **Magic Item Mastery** A seugathi can Cast a Spell from a magic item even if the spell isn't on their spell list. All such spells are occult spells and use the seugathi's innate spell DC and attack modifier. **Seugathi Venom** ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 25 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 1d6 poison damage and [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) (1 round); **Stage 2** 2d6 poison damage and [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=8) and stupefied 2 (1 round) **Warp Reality** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The seugathi bends reality in their choice of a 10-foot emanation or a 60-foot line, altering the terrain of the area. The terrain becomes a different type of terrain (such as aquatic, arctic, or desert) and becomes normal or difficult terrain, as the seugathi chooses. Structures, general geographic features, and creatures in the area aren't transformed, but creatures in the area take 5d6 chaotic damage (DC 28 basic Fortitude save) as reality tries to bend them along with the terrain. Though changes to the area are permanent, the natural environment might eventually revert the land back to its original state (aquatic areas drain, arctic areas thaw, and so on).
name: Seugathi Reality Warper

Darklands scholars refer to reality warpers as veterans in the seugathi ranks, but they're more accurately compared to aggressive landscape architects. The terrain becomes a different type of terrain (such as aquatic, arctic, or desert) and becomes normal or difficult terrain, as the seugathi chooses. Structures, general geographic features, and creatures in the area aren't transformed, but creatures in the area take 5d6 chaotic damage (DC 28 basic Fortitude save) as reality tries to bend them along with the terrain. Though changes to the area are permanent, the natural environment might eventually revert the land back to its original state (aquatic areas drain, arctic areas thaw, and so on).
